com.arthenica.mobileffmpeg

Class FFmpeg

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arthenica.mobileffmpeg.FFmpeg

  • public class FFmpeg
extends java.lang.Object

    Main class for FFmpeg operations. Provides execute(String...) method to execute FFmpeg commands. 

          int rc = FFmpeg.execute("-i file1.mp4 -c:v libxvid file1.avi");
      Log.i(Config.TAG, String.format("Command execution %s.", (rc == 0?"completed successfully":"failed with rc=" + rc));
    Since:
    v1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void cancel()
      Cancels an ongoing operation.
      static int execute(java.lang.String command)
      Synchronously executes FFmpeg command provided.
      static int execute(java.lang.String[] arguments)
      Synchronously executes FFmpeg with arguments provided.
      static int execute(java.lang.String command, java.lang.String delimiter)
      Deprecated. 
      argument splitting mechanism used in this method is pretty simple and prone to errors. Consider using a more advanced method like execute(String) or execute(String[])

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public static int execute(java.lang.String[] arguments)

        Synchronously executes FFmpeg with arguments provided.

        Parameters:
        arguments - FFmpeg command options/arguments as string array
        Returns:
        zero on successful execution, 255 on user cancel and non-zero on error

      • execute

        public static int execute(java.lang.String command,
                          java.lang.String delimiter)
        Deprecated. argument splitting mechanism used in this method is pretty simple and prone to errors. Consider using a more advanced method like execute(String) or execute(String[])

        Synchronously executes FFmpeg command provided. Command is split into arguments using provided delimiter character.

        Parameters:
        command - FFmpeg command
        delimiter - delimiter used to split arguments
        Returns:
        zero on successful execution, 255 on user cancel and non-zero on error
        Since:
        3.0

      • execute

        public static int execute(java.lang.String command)

        Synchronously executes FFmpeg command provided. Space character is used to split command into arguments. You can use single and double quote characters to specify arguments inside your command.

        Parameters:
        command - FFmpeg command
        Returns:
        zero on successful execution, 255 on user cancel and non-zero on error

      • cancel

        public static void cancel()

        Cancels an ongoing operation. This function does not wait for termination to complete and returns immediately.
